issue.subject: INSPIRE compliancy
issue.description:
It could be added to the MONITOR a compatibility check with the INSPIRE constraints :
The minimum number of requests CSW taken into account (valid when the first byte is returned) simultaneously shall be 30 per second. The probability that the service is available shall be 99%.
WMS / WFS: The minimum number of requests simultaneously taken into account should be 20 per second. The probability that the service is available shall be 99%.

journals.notes:
Hello Thomas,

That's y good idea indeed !
I see some similarity with issue #275

Let's wait for Jesper Kihlberg's explanations... it may arise that it is the same need.

NB : note that the criteria "The minimum number of requests simultaneously taken into account should be 20 per second" is quite vague. First of all, what kind of request is it (GetCapabilities, GetMap...)? if it's a GetMap, with which parameters (1,2,3 layers... width/height ?). Do you have any info Thomas ?
criterias are described in the Inspire documentations : http://inspire.jrc.ec.europa.eu/documents/Network_Services/Technical%20Guidance%20View%20Services%20v%202.0.pdf (p. 27)

In the INSPIRE Networkservice DS it says:
Performace:
"For a 470 Kilobytes image (e.g. 800 × 600 pixels with a colour depth of 8 bits), the response time for sending the initial response to a Get Map Request to a view service shall be maximum *5 seconds* in normal situation." normal situation is 90% of time. 
Capacity:
"The minimum number of simultaneous service requests to a view service (WMS) to be served in accordance with the quality of service performance criteria shall be *20 per second.*"
(the request can be limited to one layer)

The only thing what is quite vague to me, is: Should it be 20 different GetMap Request or can it be the same. (Servercaching)
What is as well still unclear to me, a 800*600 pixel GetMap request will most of the time not result in an 470KB map, because of serverside compression. I still dont't have an idea how to interpred this part.

CSW is 3 Seconds, and so on. See
See: http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=OJ:L:2010:323:0001:0010:EN:PDF

Thanks for those inputs !

Ben, you are right : service compression will make a difference. I interpret the "470 KB map" as the size without compression (because nothing is stated in the docs).

@Jorgen: I assume that this input from Thomas could be interesting to look at during the call of feed-back; don't see any way to force you about increasing your own project :-) and feel free to react about it...

The Quality of Service requirements from INSPIRE will have to be interpret and an interpretation has to be agreed upon. The discussion about iterpretation has begun in different foras that deals with implementing rules for INSPIRE.

But we, at the National Survey and Cadastre Denmark, believe that we can start implementing tools for collecting Quality of Service data and make the functionality flexible to what ever the iterpretation might be at the end of the discussion.

The Rules stated by Ben Leetz is our starting point. Which means that we propose to:
Expand the functionality of the Monitor to be able to both handle simultanious requests and report collectively on the requests see Monitor issue #275
Add functionality that can filter the 10% worst request out of the reports

It is our assessment that if any additional needs arises from the INSPIRE quality of service discissions. These can be implemented at that time.

I think Jorgen is right, we have to keep MONITOR as flexible as possible to deal with any new needs that may arise in the future. 

Nevertheless, what we could imagine is to have a kind of optionnal "setup" that would put default INSPIRE parameters for any job (for example a button with label "Apply INSPIRE QoS rules" to the job).

An INSPIRE compliance button would be perfect :-)

My thinking in relation to reporting on jobs is as stated in #276.
I think that SLA should be applied when creating a report and not when creating a job. Because of the limitations that it creates for future possibilities.
New clients with other SLA needs than the ones implemented on specific jobs might want to see how we have performed historically in relation to their specific SLA needs.
This can be acchieved per logging availability and performance 24/7/365 for all jobs created.

I don't know if it will be a button or anything else :-) but I would prefer a SLA profile that stores already SLA definition regarding INSPIRE contraints.
To specify in details through advanced modelization (UML static classes)...

Regarding current notes, I propose that Steering Committee vote to keep this issue for a future release...
Thanks

Hello Thomas,

Regarding the vote, this issue will be kept for a future release.
This ticket will be stated to "new".
